name: State_12

timeline_beats.label: Harbor charter and inland river link established
Integration into regional maritime trade networks
Fisheries sharing treaty ratified with neighbors

factions.label: Harbor Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls port tariffs, ship charters, trade licenses

factions.label: Northern Fishers Cooperative
factions.influence_hint: Mobilizes coastal fleets; seasonal political leverage

factions.label: Tide-Speakers (clerical order)
factions.influence_hint: Gatekeepers of sea-rituals; sway public seasonal rites

factions.label: Riverwardens
factions.influence_hint: Controls river transshipment and smuggling corridors

constraints: Tech baseline: near-medieval to early-industrial; no high-pressure steam megatechs
Ritual magic requires scarce imported reagents or specialist labors; consumption is material and recurrent
No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind-influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts, seamanship, or legal navigational practices
Must comply with multistate treaties (T1, T3) on open-seas access and fisheries sharing
notes: Strategic economy depends on imported reagents routed via trade partners (A1, TB2); supply shocks destabilize ritual workshops
Seasonal storms and shifting tides drive migration of fishing effort between Grand Harbor and Outer Isles
Factional tension: Harbor Guild (trade) vs Northern Fishers (access & quotas)
Obligations under Open-Seas Treaty may require naval patrol contributions during disputes
Riverwardens form informal bridge to inland commerce; control of Saltmarsh Delta is a persistent flashpoint
